clues.text: These Dostoyevsky brothers are always being asked questions like "Is there a God?"
R.L. Stevenson wrote, “I had gone to bed” this man, “I had awakened” this other man. “How was this to be explained?”
Alice B. Toklas quotes her asking, "What is the answer?"; getting none, she asked, "In that case, what is the question?"
This Poe tale begins, "True!...Nervous I had been and am; but why will you say that I am mad?"
This 3-named woman wrote the 1966 short story "Where Are You Going, Where Have You Been?"
Nolan Gould plays a less than Mensa-esque Luke Dunphy on this sitcom but Nolan's 150 IQ made the grade
Before he passed away in 2012, this general who led the Persian Gulf War went "Stormin'" to a Mensa membership
Mensa man Markus Persson sold this create-a-world-out-of-blocks computer game to Microsoft for $2.5 billion
Come up with the geodesic dome like this engineer & you can be president of Mensa like he was
Leslie Charteris had the smarts for Mensa & also to come up with the character of Simon Templar, star of this book series
As a punishment, a boy writes on a chalkboard over & over
A happy woman spins & throws her hat high into the air
A boy & his dad carry fishing poles as they leisurely walk along
A plane! A plane! arrives at a vacation resort to the delight of a diminutive employee
This 1960s Robert Conrad series opened with a 5-panel cartoon that saw a gunslinger foil a bank robbery
Centeotl, a god of these people aka the Mexica, was big into solar & also associated with feasting & pleasure
One of the 12 labors of Hercules was working in animal control, stealing this 3-headed dog
Here comes the sun god, this Egyptian deity who could have gone by "Ol' Falcon Head" but did not
This Greek monster of myth had the head of a lion, body of a goat & tail of a serpent & terrorized the kingdom of Lycia
Loki & Heimdall kill each other in this final battle of the Norse gods, aka the Day of Doom
Polynesia stretches over 5,000 miles from Hawaii to this kiwi nation
5-letter word for the leader of each clan; originally he was the leader of the group settling a new island
In 1915 missionaries from this U.S. church began building its first Polynesian temple on Oahu
Less than an hour from Tahiti by plane, this double talk isle has been called "the most beautiful island in the world"
It's the most widely spoken Polynesian language; you'll hear it in the cities of Apia & Pago Pago

rounds.comments: (Alex: You have to name the president who was in office when we acquired that particular piece of land.)

clues.text: The Panama Canal Zone, since ceded to Panama
The Mariana Islands, a U.N. trust territory formally acquired soon after the founding of the United Nations
Puerto Rico
Alaska
The Virgin Islands

rounds.comments: (Alex: You give us the correct English word from the lyric.)

clues.text: "You know, I wish that I had Jessie's puella"
"Pour some saccharon on me, ooo, in the name of love"
"Hebenus & ebur live together in perfect harmony, side by side on my piano keyboard"
"She's a maenas, maenas on the floor, & she's dancing like she's never danced before"
"Oh, what a feeling, when we're dancing on the tectum"
This photo-sharing app gets its name from combining parts of the words "instant" & "telegram"
This university's admissions office is in Crouse-Hinds Hall in Syracuse, New York
Launched in 2000, this lifestyle magazine from Time, Inc. helps keep life real simple
This centrally located African country is again a republic since elections were held in 2015
Joseph Medicine Crow, the last war chief of this Montana tribe, died in 2016 at age 102

"Perilous Fight" &

"The 13th Valley" &

Sweat & blood pressure are measured with this truth-telling aid
An institute for higher education offering courses in many vocational disciplines
An L. Frank Baum character has this 10-letter name because of her multicolored robes
Someone able to speak several languages
In some shorebirds, the females exhibit this behavior, meaning having several male mates at once
At honeymaid.com learn how to make this Graham cracker treat in a microwave, on a grill or over a campfire
These treats from Pepperidge Farm like the Parmesan & Flavor Blasted Xtra Cheddar are sure to make your cat jealous
Bite-size cracker sandwiches from Nabisco filled with peanut butter or cheese have this rhyming name
Carr's crackers from the U.K. include table water original & table water with toasted these
Keebler's version of a Saltine; its name is near the end of the alphabet
Appropriately, this river runs through the capital of Canada, right past Parliament Hill
The Taedong is the watery artery of this capital on the Korean Peninsula
One of the 2 capitals on the Congo River; they sit on opposite sides of it
This "Light" river flows south to north through Amsterdam
The Baghmati River, which flows through this Himalayan capital, is sacred to Hindus

rounds.text: "In God we trust" & this word appear on the front of every current U.S. coin
